00022 // $Id: test-sat-int16.cpp,v 1.9 2009-09-18 03:37:30 mspald Exp $
00023 
00024 /// @file   test-sat-int16.cpp
00025 /// @brief  test functions of the sat_int16 datatype.
00026 
00027 #include "normalization/sat_uint16.h"
00028 //
00029 #include <cassert>
00030 #include <cstdio>
00031 #include <ctime>
00032 #include <vector>
00033 //
00034 
00035 time_t bench_ts;
00036 time_t bench_te;
00037 
00038 #define BENCH_START() time(&bench_ts)
00039 #define BENCH_STOP()  time(&bench_te); printf("TIME=%6d\n",(int)(bench_te-bench_ts))
00040 
00041 #define PRINTF_ISI() printf("i=%d si=%d\n",int(i),int(si))
00042 
00043 int main(int argc,char *argv[]) {
00044 
00045   sat_uint16 si=0;
00046   int i,j,k;
00047 
00048   printf("sizeof(sat_uint16)=%d\n",(int)sizeof(sat_uint16));
00049   assert(sizeof(sat_uint16)==2); // crash otherwise
00050 
00051   si=i=-1;
00052   PRINTF_ISI();
00053   si=i=SAT_UINT16_MAX+1;
00054   PRINTF_ISI();
00055 
00056 #define TEST_STEPS 10
00057 #define TEST_INC   (int(SAT_UINT16_MAX*1.2/TEST_STEPS))
00058 
00059   i=0;
00060   for (j=0;j<TEST_STEPS;j++) {
00061     i+=TEST_INC;
00062     si=i;
00063     PRINTF_ISI();
00064   }
00065 
00066   // check that ++/-- work
00067   si=0;
00068   si++;
00069   assert(si==1);
00070   si--;
00071   assert(si==0);
00072 
00073 #define BENCH_REPS (100000)
00074 #define BENCH_MAX  (int(SAT_UINT16_MAX*1.5/5))
00075 
00076   printf("Native ints: ");
00077   BENCH_START();
00078   for (k=0;k<BENCH_REPS;k++) {
00079     j=0;
00080     j++;
00081     j--;
00082     for (i=0;i<BENCH_MAX;i++) {
00083       j=j+1;
00084     }
00085   }
00086   BENCH_STOP();
00087   int secs_int16=bench_te-bench_ts;
00088 
00089   printf("sat ints: ");
00090   BENCH_START();
00091   for (k=0;k<BENCH_REPS;k++) {
00092     si=0;
00093     si++;
00094     si--;
00095     for (i=0;i<BENCH_MAX;i++) {
00096       si=j+1;
00097     }
00098   }
00099   BENCH_STOP();
00100   int secs_sat_uint16=bench_te-bench_ts;
00101 
00102   printf("*** Slowdown = %f\n",double(secs_sat_uint16)/secs_int16);
00103 }
